Uses of Package
dkeep.logic

  • Classes in dkeep.logic used by dkeep.logic 
    Class and Description
    Character
    Represents a game character, derives from GameObject
    Character.State
    Used to express a character state in the game
    Club
    Represents the ogre's weapon, extends GameObject The club representation symbol is '*' A club is both passable and movable
    Door
    Represents a door, extends GameObject
    Door.State
    Used to express a door's state in game.
    DoorClosed
    Represents a closed door, extends Door The closed door representation symbol is 'I' A closed door is neither passable, nor movable
    DoorOpened
    Represents an open door, extends Door The closed door representation symbol is 'S' An open door is not movable, yet it's passable
    Dungeon
    Represents the game objects container You can call it the game board if you like so
    GameObject
    Represents an object present in the game
    GameState
    Keeps track of the features activated in the game and extra variables, such as moving enemies, weapon allwance, guard personality, ogre quantity, etc.
    Guard.Personality
    Expresses the guard personaly ROOKIE will take a default movement path DRUNKEN will randomly be stunned with possibilty of inverting the default movement path SUSPICIOUS will randomly take 1 step back while taking the default movemnt path
    Hero
    represents a hero, extends Character The hero representation symbol is 'H', if it has attacking abilities is 'A', if it has got the key in level 2 is 'K' A hero is both passable and movable
    Point
    represents a position coordinates
